A standardized questionnaire was developed for data collection of demographic data (sex and age), illness onset (symptoms, duration of symptoms) and potential risk factors (water and food consumption, patient contacts). We then collected stool and vomitus from the study set and took environmental swabs of vegetables and the chopping boards, bench surfaces, and cooking utensils used in the preparation of raw and cooked foods for laboratory diagnosis.
